bibl.title: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, March 11, 1908

div1.p: Von Mansfelde reports that the Senate Committee on Pensions voted favorably on the Lazear and Carroll pension bills. The House committee members also support the measure.

div1.head: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, March 11, 1908
div1.opener:
Nebraska State Medical Association
A. S. v. Mansfelde, M. D., Treasurer
“Quality Hill,” Ashland, Nebraska
No. 2868
March 11th 1908
Mrs. Mabel H. Lazear.
Santa Barbara
Cal.
Dear Mrs. Lazear:
div1.p:
Just a word. Just now
at 830 P.M. I had a telegram which
reads: “Senate Committee (on Pensions) voted
favorably on Lazear and Carroll bills
as drawn by Committee. Committee
report thereof in a few days.” I think this
will insure the passage in the Senate.
In the special Committee in the House
Committee on Pensions - 3 members,
Loudenslager, Richardson Draper, Mr
Richardson has given me personal assu-
rance of his hearty support for the bills.
You observe: I am not asleep
div1.closer: Ever sincerely yours ASMansfelde (I have yours of the 19th of February.)
